result.execSummary:
The defendant Caren M. Bink was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:34 a.m. Defendant Caren M. Bink in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim is present in Court. Sowinski/Victim/Burns/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence - Count 1
WHS/POP - 2 years
Jail - 6 months with Huber for all purposes. Immediate remand
Costs remitted
Restitution - must make minimum monthly payment of $186
Any monies paid to DOC as a condition of probation MUST BE APPLIED towards restitution first.
Community Service - 100 hours
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Court will consider early release from probation if all restitution/costs are paid in full. 
Appeal rights given. NADVI given.

3:32 p.m. Defendant Caren M. Bink in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant is enjoined from cashing any checks/payments received as a result of disability until further court order.

11:36 a.m. Defendant Caren M. Bink in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sowinski statement to case. Lynch statement - defendant has $75 payment to make to DOC today. Lynch speaks to defendant's intent to pay off restitution with tax refund. Sowinski requests trial date. Lynch requests additional adjournment. Court notes Deferred Entry of Judgment not Deferred Prosecution was entered into in 2015. Court wants tax returns filed with IRS and State of Wisconsin within next 10 days. Letter from accountant confirming filing of returns to be provided. Court modifies bond to enjoin defendant from cashing any checks/payments received as a result of disability until further court order. Court holds open Motion to Rescind filed by State through next hearing date. Bail continued. Adj. 11:51 a.m.  Review hearing scheduled for June 25, 2018 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: 4:00 pm. Defendant Caren M. Bink in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Voorhees statement to payments made towards restitution. Payments were made to DOC and not transferred to Clerk of Court. Voorhees requests DEJ be extended to follow term of probation which will probably be extended in July. Schiek has no objection to extension with understanding that DEJ can be rescinded if possible. Court extends DEJ through December 18, 2017. Bail continued. Adj. 4:03 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for December 18, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Caren M. Bink in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
4:08
COurt reviews history - Voorhees statement - $2000 restitution paid today- victim in court- -Court will extend DPA for balance of $5000 to be paid - To be paid through probation - Restitution was paid to us today- check to be sent to victim and Clerk to notify probation of payment - 
Court continues bond 
  Review hearing scheduled for April 17, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

3:55 P.M. Defendant Caren M. Bink in court with attorney John E Voorhees. Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sowinski - statement that she needs documentation of application for SSI benefits - requests adjournment. Court questions defendant regarding restitution - Voorhees statement that defendant was hoping for "back pay" on disability claim to pay restitution - Bail continued. 3:59 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for December 5, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

4:05 p,.m. Defendant Caren M. Bink in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Voorhees statement to defendant's inability to pay restitution - defendant has medical issues and Voorhees requests adjournment. Klemm - State is willing to extend one more time - if $2000 is not paid by next review hearing - State will move to rescind. Bail continued. Adj. 4:08 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for October 24, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
2:12 p.m. Defendant Caren M. Bink in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter adjourned until June 27, 2016. Adj. 2:13 p.m.
to reinstitute proceedings

3:41 p.m. Attorney John E Voorhees in court.  Defendant does not appear. Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bednar - no compliance with agreement - State has prepared Motion to Reinstitute due to non-payment - requests date for hearing. Voorhees statement that defendant told him she is paying restitution to DOC; defendant is not here today because she had oral surgery on Friday. Adj. 3:45 p.m.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
DPA filed
DPA Filed

01:45 pm - Defendant Caren M. Bink in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files Amended Information.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea questionnaire and DPA filed (for Count 1).    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Defendant does not appear to be under the influence and has answered all the Court's questions appropriately.  Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of counts 2 and 3 but defers judgment on Count 1 and accepts the DPA.  Bednar/Voorhees/Court statement to sentencing.   Bail continued - Count 1 DPA
Court Sentence - CC
WHS/POP 2 yrs
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Restitution Total - $10,000.00 - $3,000.00 already paid to DA trust account, of the $7,000.00 balance - $2,000.00 to be paid within next five months, $5,000.00 balance to be paid over the course of probation
Jail 30 days w/Huber for all purposes - To commence on/before within next 30 days
Obtain/maintain full time employment - Ten job searches/month until full time employment is obtained
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given  Review hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

11:59 am - Defendant Caren M. Bink in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bednar states will be amending Information and also filing DPA.  Needs time to complete Amended Information and DPA.  Court adjourns to this afternoon.
Pre-trial conference on February 24, 2015 at 11:30 am.

11:06 am - Defendant Caren M. Bink in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Voohrees statement to State's proposal - Defendant thought would receive money from family members for the upfront $5,000.00 restitution payment trying to secure loan from friend for $3,000.00 today.  Voorhees requests adjournbment to this afternoon to allow defendant to come up with the money.  Court statement to status - have been waiting for payment since September.  Court questions as to missed appearance on January 2nd and December 19th.  State is willing to adjourn to later today for the $3,000 payment and then a continuance for 30 to 45 days to come up with balance.  Court adjourns to this afternoon.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Notice of Hearing mailed directly to defendant on today's date.

10:10 am - Attorney John E. Voorhees in court.  Defendant does not appear.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions Voorhees as to non-appearance of defendant.  Voorhees states cannot confirm if written notice was provided to defendant of today's court appearance.  Has left phone messages at the two phone numbers he has for defendant.  Bednar states restitution payment has not been provided to DA's office.  Court adjourns.  Bail continued.  If defendant does not appear at the next court hearing a warrant will be issued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 11:00 am.

09:41 am - Attorney John E. Voorhees in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions Voorhees as to why defendant is not present.  Voorhees states he spoke with defendant yesterday and this morning - Defendant states very ill - going to doctor - did not feel should appear in court.  Voorhees states case has been resolved.  Bednar statement to status of case/resolution which calls for an upfront restitution payment of $5,0000.00.  Voorhees/Bednar requests continuance.  Bail continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

03:12 pm - Defendant Caren M. Bink in court with attorney John E. Voorhees.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Schiek statement to proposal concerning payment of restitution up front - joint recommendation to adjourn to allow for $5,000 payment of partial restitution.  Bail continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 09:00 am.

02:24 pm - Defendant Caren M. Bink in court with attorney John E. Voorhees.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Voorhees states has had potential resolution discussions regarding payment of restitution.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 4, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

State calls Detective Sgt. Joshua Chiamulera RPD/Sworn/Direct by Bednar/Cross by Voorhees. Court finds probable cause does exist and binds defendant over for trial.  Bail continued.  Arraignment scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
